WRITING.TITLE: I'm just done with this life, I'm ready for what comes next
WRITING.TEXT: I'm just done with this life. With this body and the choices it's made. I don't believe in heaven or hell, if anything I believe in reincarnation but honestly I don't care what happens next. But it's even easier to want to die when I believe that this story will end but maybe I'll get the chance to start a new story. I work in the mental health field. I work for an inpatient crisis stabilization hospital, and every work day I answer the phone and help people in active crisis- by either just talking to them, offering resources, or getting them into a bed at my hospital. I've talked my fair share of people off the ledge, I know all the things to say and I've been saying them to myself over and over the past year. Maybe that's why now none of the words mean anything anymore. I was inpatient myself last year after a passive suicide attempt. But what I'm feeling now is even more hopeless than it was a year ago. I'm just done trying, done caring, I just want everything to be over. I have my plan, though not all the items needed to carry it out. The only thing keeping me from leaving work right now and being done with it all, is my parents. This will destroy them. But how long can I keep "living" in this pit, dreaming about it being over- when I'm only doing it for someone else? I've started writing letters to people. One common thing I've come to realize is no one did anything wrong to me. You know how a lot of suicidal people have been beaten down, made to feel insignificant, don't have a support system? That's not the case for me. I have a support system. I have parents who raise me up. I have friends. I'm not dealing with PTSD, or some traumatic event. I know I'm not alone. I just hate myself, and see absolutely no future, nor do I want one. I'm not asking for help, I just needed to write it out. Needed to try and explain everything in my head, maybe it would make more sense after I wrote it. Or maybe I would feel lighter and more hopeful. Maybe.

Justin at Seattle Ink and Oil. He's located at the old Rainier Brewery. He is a painter by trade, and it is definitely seen in his tattoo work. I've had about $5000 worth of work down from him so far. I can guarantee if you work with him he will give you something breathtaking and unique to just you. [Seattle Ink and Oil](http://www.seattleinkandoil.com)

I work at a behavioral health hospital. Our facility helps people struggling with suicidal thoughts, anxiety, depression, as well as people struggling with active psychosis. It's a crisis stabilization hospital- meaning it's short term (5-7 days) to help a person mentally get back to a safe and stable place- and then get them set out with outpatient services. I explain this for two reasons: One, so you know, that I know, what I'm talking about. Two, If you would like any further information, or a recommendation for a facility in your state- I would be happy to help. The original question though! Mental health is the same as physical health when it comes to a patients HIPAA rights. The hospital will not share any of your medical information without your consent. So you don't have to share anything with anyone you don't want to. Legally, your employer cannot discriminate against you because of a mental illness. And if it is available to you, the hospital could help you get FMLA or short term leave. Of course there are lots of loopholes, and I could be specific with you if I knew your state and job. But basically, that's the jist of it. Hope I didn't word vomit all over you- these are the questions I answer on a daily basis at work. Let me know if you have any questions or want more information, or just to talk to someone who gets it. Cheers!

WRITING.TITLE: Books from childhood/adolescence
WRITING.TEXT: So the past couple months I've been re reading books from my childhood and adolescence, books that shaped my obsession for reading. Stories that I'm so sure I remember, then read them again years! later and I'm blown away. The list so far: Harry Potter Hatchet (actually all 5 books of Brian's Saga) The Giver (and its three "sequels") Island of the Blue Dolphins Protector of the Small series by Tamora Pierce Where the Red Fern Grows Beautiful Joe Number the Stars Julie of the Wolves To Kill a Mockingbird Fellow readers, do you have any suggestions for books to put on my list? Preferably I'm looking for short stories, or books that were read in grammar or middle school. Books that you won't forget but haven't read in decades. The books that inspired in you a passion for reading and escaping into another world and time. Thank you fellow Bibliophiles! #128214;

If you like dark comedy, I strongly recommend "Digging up Mother: a Love Story" by Doug Stanhope. Very dark subject matter, not for the easily offended- but highly entertaining and laugh out loud funny at times. Books runs just short of 13 hours.
How about the House of Night series by Kristin and P.C Cast. Very YA, vampires, drama, mind numbing, easy read.1
If you want a book where you finish it and you're not sure if you like or dislike the characters, give Lev Grossman's The Magicians a try.
If you want non fiction memoir, "Digging Up Mother: a Love Story" by comedian Doug Stanhope is the definition of dark comedy.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm new to vaping, would someone be willing to answer a couple questions?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello there community! I'm basically brand new to the vaping scene, and haven't been very lucky in finding the answers to my questions on Google. I was hoping someone would be kind enough to answer a couple! I just purchased a Smok ProColor 225w with a Smok TFV8 Baby Beast tank. It was a coworkers spare that she sold me at a super great price. I've been playing around with it today, but still have a few questions. Firstly, what does the Watt setting exactly mean? Bigger smoke? Harsher smoke? Neither of those things? And what is the benefit to using a lower or higher watt level? Also, In the Mode setting there are five different options for me to choose: W, Ti, Wi, SS, and M. What do these options mean, what does it change and how does it change my vaping? On W mode it asks if I want to preheat? On Ti, Wi, and SS is also has the acronyms TCR- what does this mean? And then on M mode is states "mem". What does all this mean? I apologize for what are probably very noob questions, but hope someone would be willing to educate me. I also wanna say thanks in advance to anyone who will take the time! Any other hints, tips, or bit of education would be so greatly appreciated! Thanks all!

WRITING.TITLE: Suggestion for dyslexic uncle
WRITING.TEXT: This past week I have spent more time with my uncle than ever before in my life. We smoked and chatted on the back porch a lot. One thing we talked about was how much I love to read. You see I'm an avid reader (150 books read this year so far) and my uncle was really interested in why I read so much. Other than just loving to read, I also love to escape into a fictional world. My uncle is severely dyslexic, he can barely write and can't read at all. Something he shared with me is how ashamed this makes him feel, and how he has always wanted to get lost in a book but can't. He isn't very technologucal and has never tried audiobooks. I would love to give him an audiobook this Christmas but have no clue where to start. I read mostly fantasy and I don't think he would really enjoy those types of books. I'm thinking something relativly short but engaging. My uncle has been a union glazer in Chicago for 35 years, he's a guys guy who has a short fuse, smokes a lot of cigarettes, drinks a lot of bee, and loves to laugh. All he knows is how to work with his hands, and would do anything for his family. Community would you have any suggestions for me?

[The Trilogy of Two](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23846000-the-trilogy-of-two) is the first book that came to my mind. It's about female twins, who are very different from one another. If you're boys are too young for Harry Potter this may be a little too old for them, but I still wanted to recommend it!

WRITING.TITLE: For my birthday my sister sent me her Playbill from when she went to see Hamilton during Pride Month. Today I matted and framed it. I don't know when I'll ever have the funds to see the show myself, but at least I can enjoy looking at this every day!

You can try Armada, also by Ernest Cline. I didn't find it quite as compelling as Ready Player One, but it was definitely entertaining.

Very simple, easy to read books but "The Hatchet" by Gary Paulsen is your quitesensial survival book. There are actually five books in total, all part of "Brian's Saga". I re-read them all this past year (as an adult) and enjoyed them just as much as I did when I was a kid.
If he enjoys Far Cry he'll enjoy this.

WRITING.TITLE: The need to self harm is gone (for the moment), but the desire is still very much there.
WRITING.TEXT: Finally got some medication to help my severe anxiety. First little bit of relief in two weeks. Finally gave in and relapses two days ago- it'd been about six months. First night did some minor scratching and a couple barely there cuts. Not much stayed. But the release I got from it at the time was amazing. Got little sleep still, and was a mess at work- ended up coming home early and sleeping about 14 hours. Then last night I cut, small shallow lines. The relief was still there but so was pain this time. Typically this is why I scratch (or use sandpaper), it just feels better. Today I was constantly looking at them, or touching them to make sure they were still there. After work today I went to the ER (I live in a super small town and that's the only thing open at 9pm) to get me a script to last me the weekend until my physician can write me something. So basically right now I'm feeling the best I have in weeks. Not manic or euphoric, or particulary happy- but not in a near constant state of needing to flee panic. But, all night (and most of the day) I've been thinking about self harming. Since I got home, I've been carrying my knife in my pocket. Feeling it. Wants so badly to use it. But I don't /need/ it. I use self harm to help control my anxiety and get me calm, that's the excuse I allow myself. But now I am calm- I don't need to do something else to refocus me. But it's all I can think about, and all I want to do. /sigj/ who ever said self harm wasn't an addiction, has apparently never truly felt self harm compulsions, or has never felt addiction.
